question: Neisseria gonorrhoeae, when Gram-stained and viewed microscopically, appears as which of the following?

answers.option: Gram negative cocci in grape like cluster
Gram positive cocci in grape like cluster

question: SIRS is a life-threatening disease that can lead to multiple organ failure, if not treated immediately. What does it stand for?

answers.option: It stands for septicemic inflammation related syndrome
It stands for systemic inflammatory response syndrome
It stands for systems involved in infection syndrome
It stands for system inflammation related syndrome
It stands for systematic infection related syndrome

question: A young girl is admitted to the hospital with frequent bouts of fever that are associated with rigor and chills. On examination of blood film, crescent banana-shaped structures are seen. Her urine turns black on exposure to air. Which of the following organisms is the cause of the patient's symptoms?

What is a common side effect of clofazimine?

What is the etiology of pseudomembranous colitis?
What organism causes leprosy?

A 68-year-old male presents to the emergency room with complaints of diarrhea, vomiting, and abdominal pain. History suggests that he is immunocompromised and suffering from prostate carcinoma for the past 6 years. His laboratory investigations reveal low hemoglobin, raised erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR), and decreased total leukocyte count (TLC). His diagnosis is made by detecting oocysts in fecal smear with the help of a modified Kinyoun acid-fast stain. Which of the following organisms is responsible for his symptoms?
Which of the following is true about Plasmodium falciparum malaria?

answers.option: It is common in developed countries

question: A person was bitten by a mosquito and later developed malaria. Which of the following does the mosquito inject when it takes a blood meal?
Prevention of fecal-oral transmission is unlikely to be achieved by which of the following?
What vaccines are given at birth according to the Expanded Program of Immunization (EPI) in Pakistan?

answers.option: BCG, IPV, and H. influenzae type B

question: A 19-year-old is brought to the clinic with complaints of epigastric abdominal pain and vomiting for the past 1 week. They were working barefoot in the fields preparing for the harvest. Physical examination reveals generalized pallor. Which of the following parasites would most likely be identified on stool examination?
What is the treatment for tertiary syphilis?

answers.option: Single dose of intramuscular penicillin G

question: Which of the following is caused by rotavirus?

answers.option: Awareness campaigns to increase better hygiene practices are effective
Masks are effective in limiting transmission
Improvement in sanitation limits mosquito reproduction

A child has not been going to school because he has a vesicular rash over the face and trunk, along with a high-grade fever. 2 weeks ago the child went on a cruise where a boy had similar symptoms. What is the causative organism of this child's condition?

A 41-year-old man, with a history of HIV/AIDS, presents to the outpatient clinic with worsening dyspnea and cough for the last 5 days. The cough is non-productive and associated with a low-grade fever. A CD4+ count is ordered and is found to be 160 cells/mm3. Bronchoalveolar lavage, treated with methenamine silver staining, shows disc-shaped yeast cells. Which of the following organisms is most likely linked to this man's condition?

A 21-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a mild fever and increased urinary frequency. She complains of urinary hesitancy and also pain while urinating. She also reports pain in the pubic area after voiding. There is no history of chills, rigors, or nausea. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient is admitted to the hospital for surgery. On the 8th day of admission, they develop fever, dyspnea, and productive cough. A chest X-ray shows consolidations in the right lower lobe. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not involved in the management of tetanus infections?

answers.option: Intramuscular injection of human tetanus immunoglobulin
Immediate debridement and cleaning of the wound

answers.option: Rupturing cells releasing parasites into the bloodstream

question: Which of the following is the best method to diagnose mumps?

answers.option: A hostile witness is being questioned
When the witness is of unsound mind
When an expert has been called
When the judge wishes to ask questions

question: A man presents to the emergency department of the hospital and is referred to a medicolegal officer due to a suspicious stab wound on his abdomen. However, the clothes he wore had no incision. Which of the following is the best explanation for this man's case?

A 4-year-old child is brought to the clinic with a history of fever and right knee swelling for the past one week. For the last month, he has been having dysuria on and off and urethral discharge. Temperature is 102°F upon examination, blood pressure is 80/60 mmHg, respiratory rate is 24 breaths per minute, and heart rate is 64 beats per minute.
